I have two daughters and as much as I love how much knowledge is at their fingertips and how many amazing things can be found online it also scares me to think how much negative there is aswell. My oldest is 14 and is pretty much attached to her phone with how things have been the last few months I’ve allowed it with it being the only way to communicate with her friends and have social interaction but my four year old had started asking for YouTube videos which most of the time is fine but also it worries me that this is how her generation will grow up.
I’ll be taking part in this and I’ve ordered a bath bomb looking forward to watching more videos and learning a little more, I’m also hoping to find an easier way to explain to my girls aswell without making the internet seem a negative thing

I have just finished 6 weeks off of social media after I just found it all too much to handle. It had started to affect how I viewed myself and I questioned who I was. It has changed my perspective on how I go about using social media and why I use it. I encourage everyone to do this whether it is for one day or one month as it has made me rediscover myself and really helped improve my mental health. During these times we are using social media more than every to stay in touch but just take some time for your self, and not be constantly waiting for that notification. Don’t let your phone control you!

I love it Zoe! I hope everyone joins me in detoxing, here’s some things you can do on sep. 5. drink tea, clean up, talk to your family and friends, read, make home made meals, play with your pets, go outside in the sun, think of reasons life is beautiful, go for a walk, write your feelings down or make fun lists of things to do/get, play records, dance, (off tiktok.) sing😊 xx

I totally understand and support the concept of this social media detox day but for some like me that doesn’t really have any friends in real life that I can hang out with except for one that I meet on social media and that lives far away from me and can only see like ones or twice a year but talk on social media everyday. I just want to say thank you because if you haven’t talked about your anxiety and letting us see you struggle and work against it I would never had understood why I feel like I do and understand my anxiety as I now do so thank you Zoe for everything through all of these years.

I took 2 weeks off social media earlier this year to help my mental health. It was overwhelming to me the effects of just being away and even going through the slight withdrawal. I'm not a heavy social media user but I was getting very involved due to the climate of the world this year and more specifically all the issues going on in my home country (America) I think I had dealt with generalized anxiety for this first time in my life and did not have the coping skills to recognize what was happening. Those two weeks away really helped me recognize the signs of being overly influenced by the content I was taking in and the importance of putting a boundary onto social media when it starts to negatively affect me. I am actually on an insta and twitter detox this weekend and its a practice I intend to maintain now. So I love this campaign and I too will be participating in Digital Detox Day on 05/09/20! <3
